full_summary:
# Kingston (Bath Institution) Temporary Construction Zone Phase 2 Tender Notice
***
### Request for Proposal (RFP) Details
#### Official Title
* English: Kingston (Bath), Ontario. Phase 2 Bath Institution, Temporary Construction Zone
* French: Établissement de Bath, Kingston (Bath), Ontario. Phase 2 Zone de construction temporaire

#### Reference Number
WS3976625188-Doc4300745202

#### Amendment Number
6

#### Solicitation Number
WS3976625188

#### Publication Date
2023-11-15

#### Tender Closing Date and Time
2023-12-12T14:00:00

#### Amendment Date
2023-12-06

#### Expected Contract Start Date
2023-05-31

#### Expected Contract End Date
(N/A)

#### Tender Status
Expired

### Service Description
Public Works and Government Services Canada Real Property Branch have a requirement to tender this project on behalf of Correctional Service Canada to Design and Construct a Temporary Construction Zone (TCZ) as a pre-requisite for the new 96 bed living unit project.

### Conditions of Tender
#### Trade Agreement
Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

#### Geographic Region
Ontario, Canada, and Kingston

#### Procurement Method
Competitive - Open Bidding

#### Selection Criteria
Lowest Price

#### Regions of Delivery
Ontario (except National Capital Region), Canada, and Kingston

### Upcoming Tender Snapshot
* Deadline for bid submission: 2023-12-12T14:00:00
* Estimated Start Date: 2023-05-31

### Additional Requirements
Please visit the SAP Ariba RFx Event for complete details.

### About the Project
The contractor must perform and complete the project, including all Temporary Construction Zone Temporary Construction Zone, by 29 November 2024. It is a two-phase process: the first phase evaluated the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and the second phase invites the qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. 

**Contracting Authority and Contact**
Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Contact: Sheila Dhanna (she/her), E-mail: sheila.dhanna@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

Note that the technical writer maintains the original terminology, but carefully phrases the text to address the specialist audience and include only the most relevant information for them, ensuring clarity
